title: Unable to sync from Parity warped nodes
body:
I'm having this issue while trying to sync in geth with Parity. Seems like Parity does not have the full blockchain, and the blocks requested by Geth are not yet available at that instance, but that client is synced because it warp synced.

Also, I'm unable to export db from that 'synced' Parity instance. (see https://github.com/paritytech/parity/issues/6933 )

See geth logs:

```
INFO [10-30|21:32:08] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/v1.7.2-stable-1db4ecdc/linux-amd64/go1.9

```
Please also share your parity logs. I just want to make sure this is not a parity or configuration issue.

Now the geth sync finished, but the parity logs were the regular output, nothing special. 
I guess that warp sync makes Parity node getting sync on state but not on history, so when geth asks for a certain block it might not have. Maybe would be good to have some better communication of Parity blockchain capabilities to other nodes?
A warp-synced node has all blocks available after fetching the ancient blocks. Can you see whether the ancient blocks were downloaded yet or not?
How do I look this info of ancient blocks already downloaded? (
It's the yellow block numbers in the log / stdout.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
